html:
Welcome to Last Drop, where you can discover the newest and buzziest beauty launches hitting shelves near you.

Shark FlexFusion Air & Ceramic System with Air Straightener

Shark’s newest launch is the ultimate hair savior—it essentially has every tool you need to create any style, whether you want a bouncy blowout or sleek, stick-straight hair. The attachments include a hair dryer, ceramic straightener, blow dryer brush, and 1.24-inch curlers, and they all promise to style your strands with little to no heat damage. The brand also collaborated with dermatologists to create a scalp shield mode to protect your scalp from the detrimental effects of heat exposure. If you’re the kind of person who likes to have options, even while traveling, it’s worth looking into this multi-styler.

Missha M Perfect Serum BB Cream

If the viral M Perfect Cover BB Cream and Night Repair Ampoule had a baby, it would be Missha’s newest BB Cream. It has all the coverage of the former with the anti-aging benefits of the latter. The formula features both probiotics and antioxidants to support the health of the skin barrier and combat free radicals, which can cause many common signs of aging like wrinkles and dark spots. And at the end of the day, it’s designed to keep your skin looking like skin, but better.

OPI x Wicked Nail Lacquer 12 Piece Mini Pack

We have less than two months before the premiere of Wicked, and OPI is celebrating with a brand new collection of nail polishes. Get a taste of all of the shades with this advent calendar, which includes 12 mini polishes all inspired by different characters in the movie. If we had to guess, we’d hypothesize that at least one of the greens is inspired by Elphaba—but what do we know?

ELLE Editors’ October Prime Day Picks

Carol Lee is the Associate Beauty E-Commerce Writer at ELLE.com, where she covers all things beauty and personal care. Before joining the team, she was an editor at Food Network Magazine and HGTV Magazine and ran the beauty section at The Pioneer Woman. Carol received her bachelor’s degree in Journalism from New York University and was one of the first customers to visit Glossier’s flagship store in New York’s Soho neighborhood. Over the years, she’s tested countless makeup, hair, and skin care products, and written hundreds of articles covering the beauty space, from pieces about the trendiest launches to roundups of the best products on the market. As a Korean-American, she grew up in a sea of Korean makeup and skin care products and is a bona fide expert on the ever-expanding world of K-beauty, helping lead our coverage. Additionally, she’s also always on the hunt for the perfect lipstick and watches the same few comfort sitcoms (Frasier, Cheers, Seinfeld, New Girl, etc.) over and over again.
